content: Chief Complaint: Local redness, swelling, heat, and pain on the right forearm for 3 days.
Sour, heavy, swollen, and painful right lower limb for 6 months; worsening over the last week.

content: Preliminary Diagnosis: Furuncle of the right forearm

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Kingsport General Hospital, what are the long-term medical orders for patients J. Rodriguez and A. Davis?

content: Long-term Orders: Topical antibiotics (Mupirocin ointment) applied to affected area twice daily; Oral antibiotics (Cephalexin 250 mg) three times daily for 7 days
1. Compression stockings to be worn daily.
2. Elevate right leg when sitting or lying.
3. Ibuprofen 200 mg orally every 6 hours as needed for pain.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital, patient J. Rodriguez's long-term medical orders include topical antibiotics (Mupirocin ointment) applied to the affected area twice daily and oral antibiotics (Cephalexin 250 mg) three times daily for 7 days; according to the hospitalization records of Kingsport General Hospital, patient A. Davis's long-term medical orders include wearing compression stockings daily, elevating the right leg when sitting or lying, and taking Ibuprofen 200 mg orally every 6 hours as needed for pain.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Granville General Hospital and Kingsport General Hospital, who was admitted earlier, J. Rodriguez or A. Davis?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: J. Rodriguez was admitted on February 26, and A. Davis was admitted on March 1. J. Rodriguez was admitted earlier.
